thread.title: EUR/USD Eyes May Low- USD/CAD Holds Key Resistance Ahead of CPI
thread.title_full: EUR/USD Eyes May Low- USD/CAD Holds Key Resistance Ahead of CPI

title: EUR/USD Eyes May Low- USD/CAD Holds Key Resistance Ahead of CPI
text: Chart - Cre ated Using FXCM Marketscope 2.0 EUR/USD slips to a fresh monthly low 1.0853 as the European Central Bank (ECB) retains its pledge to ‘fully implement’ its asset-purchase program until at least September 2016; remains at risk for a further decline as the bearish momentum in the Relative Strength Index (RSI) gathers pace. Despite the dovish rhetoric, it seems as though the bar remains high for the central bank to implement more non-standard measures as ECB President Mario Draghi highlights the positive data prints coming out of the monetary union. Nevertheless, the DailyFX Speculative Sentiment Index (SSI) shows retail crowd remains net-short EUR/USD since March 9, with the ratio continuing to come off of extremes as it sits at -1.17. USD/CAD USD/CAD remains at risk for a further advance following the Bank of Canada (BoC) rate cut amid the growing deviation in the policy outlook; will keep a close eye on the topside targets as the RSI pushes deeper into overbought territory. Canadian dollar may regain its footing over the next 24-hours of trading as the headline reading for the Consumer Price Index (CPI) is expected to show an uptick in June, but weakness in the core rate of inflation may put increased pressure on the BoC to implement additional monetary support as the central bank cuts its 2015 growth forecast. Closing price above near-term resistance around 1.2940 (78.6% retracement) to 1.2950 (50% expansion) will bring up the next topside objective around 1.3080 (61.8% expansion).
